instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
Liquid damage board around J8300
J8300 replaced as pin 3 was burned out.

Got chime, fans spin, USB light but no image.

<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> got 5V

<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> got
Resistors around <CHIP>U8340</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8340</CHIP> are OK.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> got" 0V, or 2.5v???
We need to know <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> level.

Do you miss image and backlight too?
Did you check all the traces between J8300 and all C832x caps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> got 3.33V

Miss image and backlight.

All traces between J8300 and all C832x caps got continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
Check external video.
Post <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> voltages.

threads.message:

threads.message: Ok tried known good display assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/17 0V"
Missing enable signal for backlight.

"<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> got 5V
---------------------
<CHIP>U8330</CHIP>/3 0V"
This is not possible, unless <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is shorted.
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> is required to enable 5V on pins 28-30 of J8300!!!

If you checked these voltages without LCD connected, NOT good.
Check all again; less keyboard backlight signals/voltages (not needed).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, got chime and fan spin
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> had back 3.33V on pin 3.

Tested with another display and had image but no backlight.
J8300/1 0V.
J8300/10 3.33V
J8300//30 5V

The issue was with two traces on J8300/3 and J8300/4. Both Had 0V. Jumpers from other side of the board.
5V was back on both pins and got backlight.

Maaany thanks guys for tips :)
